definition: sound and meaning
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: In modern poetry, there are sound and meaning with the structure of the phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 在現代詩詞中存在着音義同構的現象。

sentences.english: "Sudden leap" is not only the literal quaint, but both sound and meaning.
sentences.chinese: “趵突”不僅字面古雅，而且音義兼顧。

sentences.english: After careful screening we finally have selected a body of 463 vocabulary items showing parallels between Chinese and Thai.
sentences.chinese: 經過細心篩選，我們收錄了463個漢泰音義近似詞。

sentences.english: There're many regular patterns of phonetic and semantic correspondences between connatural Korean words and those in ancient Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮語的一些固有詞與漢語詞有音義對應關係。

sentences.english: Li Ji's Jiuzhang Suanshu Yinyi (Phonetic Significance of the Nine-Chapter Arithmetic) has never been highly regarded, nor received any due attention.
sentences.chinese: 李籍《九章算術音義》一直未受到應有的重視。

sentences.english: The author attempts to address this issue by analyzing some examples of this phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 文章就此類音義錯位現象選例作一些辨析。

definition: Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
commentary and subcommentary (of a book)
Kong Yingda (574-648), Confucian scholar
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
to annotate (ancient texts)/commentaries
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar

Prime tortoise of the record bureau, Song dynasty historical encyclopedia of political essays, autobiography, memorials and decrees, compiled 1005-1013 under Wang Qinruo 王欽若|王钦若 and Yang Yi 楊億|杨亿, 1000 scrolls
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying

History of Wei of the Northern Dynasties, tenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Wei Shou 魏收[Wei4 Shou1] in 554 during Northern Qi Dynasty 北齊|北齐[Bei3 Qi2], 114 scrolls
to check and correct
addendum
Guliang Annals, commentary on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], first published during the Han Dynasty
Huangting Jing, one of the primary scriptures of Daoism
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
posthumous (painting, calligraphy, prose etc)
